{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine how much drug will remain after 6 hours, we need to calculate the elimination rate constant (k) using the given information. The elimination rate constant (k) can be calculated using the formula: k = (0.693 / t1/2), where t1/2 is the half-life of the drug. Since the drug follows first-order kinetics, we can use the formula: t1/2 = (0.693 / k).
